Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Using nuget.core 2.14.0 with https://www.nuget.org/api/v2 no longer allows finding packages." (#9000) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

We are using NuGet.Core 2.14.0 with https://www.nuget.org/api/v2 and yesterday we started experiencing an error blocking finding packages.

We are getting the following exception on almost all packages we try to find using FindPackages(...)
System.InvalidOperationException: Response version '3.0' is not supported. The only supported versions are: '1.0', '2.0'.

We are in the process of updating to a newer version of nuget it would be nice to get this fixed.

### Repro Steps

You can also reporduce this manually by for example doing doing a manual request in browser:

1. https://packages.nuget.org/api/v2/FindPackagesById()?id=Newtonsoft.Json
2. Check Response Headers.
3. DataServiceVersion: 3.0 is returned.

### Expected Behavior

Expected behaviour would be to return a version of DataServices that still works with NuGet.Core 2 when using v2 feed.

### Screenshots

Problem when using NuGet.Core
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6636662/153552470-e9d14f01-efdd-4a9c-a17a-4d3ef2f38424.png)

Manual repro:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6636662/153556272-29be80a1-213d-4757-ad40-ddd73843c663.png)


### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Download counters not updating for pre-release packages?" (#8979) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

## TL/DR

It seems to me that the download counter is not working for versions of packages that are marked as pre-release.

The total download for a package that has pre-release versions but also "normal" versions seems to work fine, even though each pre-release version is stuck at 0 (zero).

Please note that the usual delay of 24/48h for the stats to be updated is already passed, since we are at around 6 days.
Also, in these 6 days the other downloads seem to have been updated just fine: I'm talking about my **global** downloads, the downloads for each **package as a whole**, and the downloads for each **package version** that is NOT a pre-release version.


## The setup

Up until last week I had 3 packages on nuget.org , all of them had some versions released in the last year, and none of those versions were pre-release (per semantic versioning).

All was fine.

Last week (Jan 27th to be precise) I uploaded 2 completely new packages (both with a pre-release version) and 3 new versions (again, all pre-release) of the 3 existing packages.
So all of these were in "alpha1" version.
Then about 3 days after that i pushed another pre-release version ("alpha2") for all of the 5 packages.

You can see all 5 of them [here](https://www.nuget.org/profiles/jodydonetti) (screenshot taken 2022-02-02):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152252639-1d57cb56-60c9-4d44-8e71-c5548df49e88.png)

(Now don't be fooled by the 0.1.9 you can see as the "Latest version" for the first 3 packages, since what is shown is the latest non-pre-release version, as I'm sure you know)

So, all these packages have an actual last version that is pre-release (currently "alpha2").


## The Problem

The problem is that since then, the download counters for each pre-releae version remained stuck at 0 (zero), even though me and other people already downloaded them.

See screenshots below for some evidence.

### Repro Steps

Hypothetically:
- upload a new pre-release version of an existing package OR upload a completely new package (with a pre-release version)
- make some downloads
- wait a couple of days
- download stats will not increase

### Expected Behavior

Download stats SHOULD increase.

### Screenshots

## New package

Downloads for one of the new packages ([this](https://www.nuget.org/packages/ZiggyCreatures.FusionCache.Backplane.StackExchangeRedis/0.1.0-alpha2)) after 6 days:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152254941-84a73ae1-4146-495c-8c6a-8de0828ef696.png)

## Existing package

Downloads for one of the existing packages ([this](https://www.nuget.org/packages/ZiggyCreatures.FusionCache/0.1.9)) after 6 days:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152255046-23f4fcda-e4cc-4c13-957e-a64710c3129f.png)

Note that as, I said above, in the last 6 days the downloads for the v0.1.9 kept increasing.

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: Enhance the NuGetGallery backfill tools to allow a specific set of packages to be reprocessed" (#8961) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

Current the backfill tool only allows the full DB to be reprocess via a "collect" command then an "update" command.


### The Elevator Pitch

Let's add a way to provide a big list of package IDs and versions to reprocess. These IDs and versions can be sourced from NuGet.Insights or Gallery DB depending on the situation. 

### Additional Context and Details

It looks like we may have some data issues in the package compatible frameworks data. This will allow us to fix bugs and reprocess select packages which is much faster than a full backfill.

Closed issue "NuGet.exe list from local packages folder does not work with the AllVersion flag" (#4537) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet.exe list does not work with the AllVersions flag:

NuGet version: 4.0.0.2275
From an e-mail:

```
Nuget 4.0 doesn't mix -prerelease and -allversions correct from 'nuget list'.

Nuget.exe FileVersion 4.0.0.2275


\nuget.4.0\NuGet.exe list zjrunner.test.delist -prerelease -allversions -source \\zackrun1\f$\teststore
Zjrunner.Test.Delist 3.0.0-0



Compare to 3.6 (3.5 + one private fix for VisualStudio team done by markosb)

\nuget.3.6\NuGet.exe list zjrunner.test.delist -prerelease -allversions -source \\zackrun1\f$\teststore
Zjrunner.Test.Delist 1.0.0
Zjrunner.Test.Delist 2.0.0
Zjrunner.Test.Delist 3.0.0-0
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Restore fails in VS with NullReferenceException when unloaded project uses lock file" (#11590) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Other/NA

### Product Version

17.1

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

From internal issue: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Restoring-nuget-packages-in-a-solution-w/1659149

Normally when you have a project reference to project that is not in the solution, and it has not yet been restored/built, you get an NU1105 error.

However, if the project uses a lock file, then VS will report a null reference exception. This makes it very difficult to determine what the problem is, and even if you happen to know that it's missing a project in the solution, the NRE doesn't tell us which project isn't in the solution.

[unloadedWithLockFile.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/8051829/unloadedWithLockFile.zip)
 

### Verbose Logs

```shell
> Error occurred while restoring NuGet packages: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
> at NuGet.ProjectModel.PackagesLockFileUtilities.IsLockFileValid(DependencyGraphSpec dgSpec, PackagesLockFile nuGetLockFile)
> at NuGet.Commands.RestoreCommand.<EvaluatePackagesLockFileAsync>d__46.MoveNext()
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add a means of handling duplicated patterns in PackageSourceMapping" (#11589) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
A couple of options here could be: 

- The modes concept originally proposed in the initiali package namespaces design, that simply disallows duplicated patterns.
- Warning when duplicated patterns are seen.
- Warning when more specific duplicated patterns are seen, error when `*` patterns are seen, etc.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[DCR]: Nuget updates need to be much faster" (#11586) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Current Behavior

When you use the update functionality for nuget, the UI makes hundreds and hundreds of web calls to api.nuget.org which can take 10 seconds+ just to bring up the page. If you choose something to update and click install, it can take another 10 seconds+ to work out what it is going to install. Once it has installed (which is relatively quick usually), it then reloads the page by making hundreds more requests.

Rinse and repeat, especially if things fail for dependency reasons and it can easily take an hour just to update a handful of libraries in a project with around 100 nuget dependencies. (This is netfx)

Moving between tabs, it reloads everything again.

### Desired Behavior

This behaviour should be massively cached. Existing versions of nugets are very unlikely to change so the data can be cached locally on the machine. It should not reload when moving between tabs, if it has already worked out what updates are available, then moving to the updates tab should be instant.

### Additional Context

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Allow to user to input custom (floating) versions through the PM UI" (#9829) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Change version input to a Combo Box displaying available version depending on the user input. This will allow users to select a floating version to install.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Warn about package source mapping section without pattern rules" (#11585) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Recently we got feedback on how to enable `packageSourceMapping`. Currently just having it `nuget.config` doesn't actually do anything, restore happens without any pattern rules.

For example:
```
  <packageSourceMapping> 
  </packageSourceMapping>
```

Above scenario implicitly happen nuget.config in child folder even though parent `nuget.config` had valid rules.
```
  <packageSourceMapping> 
      <clear />
  </packageSourceMapping>
```

Even below on does nothing since there is no pattern yet:
```
  <packageSourceMapping> 
    <packageSource key="nuget">
    </packageSource>
  </packageSourceMapping>
```

Below one does enable package source mapping rules.
```
  <packageSourceMapping> 
    <packageSource key="nuget">
        <package pattern="system.*" />
    </packageSource>
  </packageSourceMapping>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add progress reporting during package installation" (#11432) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Follow up to: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9782

In order to keep the changes manageable, the progress reporting for package installation/uninstallation/updates will be added separately.
